page.title: 13Cuckney C.E.Primary School.
page.content: Cuckney School is the oldest school in the area .Its building was once a water-powered cotton_mill which was standing in 1786.It has a roll of 65 children mostly from the catchment area of Cuckney,Norton,Nether Langwith,Holbeck and the Welbeck Estate, who are divided by age into 3 classes.Most travel to school by bus. It is unusual in that the Welbeck Estate has granted it the use of the adjoining mill-dam for fishing,and the present Head Mr.L.J.Beldham raises additional money for the school fund by operating a community Fishing Club. There are 3 full-time and 1 part-time staff including the Head.Despite falling rolls and the age of the building ,money has recently been spent on improvements such as Fire alarms and Fire Doors.Mr.Beldham would like indoor toilets however.
